meanings.definition: The study of the geography of ancient times.
meanings.sent1: In paleogeography, scientists explore the old maps of the Earth.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use paleogeography to learn about ancient landscapes.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeography class had fun drawing maps of prehistoric lands.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of paleogeography allowed her to visualize the Earth's past like a time traveler.
meanings.sent5: The textbook on paleogeography made the ancient world come alive.

meanings.definition: The ancient geographical features of a region.
meanings.sent1: The paleogeography of the area showed where mountains used to be.
meanings.sent2: Exploring the paleogeography helps us understand how the land has changed.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined dinosaurs roaming the paleogeography of their town.
meanings.sent4: The paleogeography resembled a puzzle of the Earth's history.
meanings.sent5: Studying the paleogeography revealed the secrets of the past landscape.

meanings.definition: The reconstruction of past landscapes and environments.
meanings.sent1: Through paleogeography, scientists recreate ancient habitats.
meanings.sent2: The paleogeography project aimed to visualize prehistoric ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeography experiment accidentally brought dinosaurs back to life!
meanings.sent4: Her drawings of paleogeography were like windows to another time.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit used paleogeography to transport visitors to the past.
